{ "step_by_step_thinking": "Gingivoplasty is a surgical procedure to reshape the gums. It is often necessary when the gums have been damaged or affected by a disease. Acute necrotizing ulcerative gingivitis, desquamative gingivitis, and erosive lichen planus are all conditions that can cause damage to the gums, potentially necessitating gingivoplasty. Acute herpetic gingivostomatitis, on the other hand, is a viral infection that causes inflammation and sores in the mouth, but it does not typically cause the kind of gum damage that would require gingivoplasty.", "answer_choice": "D" }
